Then you can buy a fire extinguisher for your burning a$$, and we'll buy glasses because font in your message is too small.@miningrelease

comments.author: energy_xxx
comments.body: Brother, the point you don't understand is that I have never invested in POS coins in my life, but such projects must be decentralized. I have not invested in projects that pre-mine and then list them and dump them on the public. If you want to do a project, if someone is harmed due to a mistake you made or an attack, the project developer must cover that damage. It must provide confidence to investors. If you try to develop the project, that community will provide the necessary support for you to develop some projects in time. There are a couple of projects in this Ghostrider algo that work well, but unfortunately the developers have the mentality of open the network, list it and throw it away, which prevents the development of these projects. It loses its functionality and becomes history. Of course, the person who develops the project will make money after all, but he will leave this financial expansion to the community and the rest will come. This is what we want to say.
